title: Spinach and Cheese Stuffed Pasta Shells

Ingredients.3: 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.2: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Gently place pasta shells in boiling water; return water to a boil. Cook until shells are just tender; drain well.

Directions.3: Squeeze spinach dry and place in a large mixing bowl. Add ricotta, 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese, fennel, basil, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper; mix well.

Directions.4: Spread 1/2 cup spaghetti sauce evenly over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Directions.5: Fill each pasta shell with spinach-cheese mixture. Arrange shells, filling-side up, in the baking dish. Spoon remaining spaghetti sauce over shells. Sprinkle remaining Parmesan cheese on top of shells.

Directions.6: Cover the pan loosely with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 30 minutes.
